intro: Hosackia biolettii, commonly known as the California larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Hosackia biolettii is often found in California and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
